intro: Acinodendron lamprarrhenum, commonly known as the red-flowered acacia, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often compound leaves. The plant features small, yellowish-green leaves that are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets. Its most distinctive feature is its bright red flowers, which are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
